May
Eighteenth,
2 75
Ir. Iloyd H. Berendsen,
1517 Lake St.,
San Francisco.
Dear Sir:
In line with its policy to obtain data to enable it to
secure the best possible location for a municipal air port, the
City and County of San Francisco would like to locate on Varney
fleld, as per the enclosed may, a temporary structure for the
purpose of securing meteorological data.
The work will be in
charge of men aseigned from the United States Weather Bureau and
the period of observation wil be from July 1, 1927, to June 30,
1928. It is our desire to commence the construction of the
necessary building and installation of the necessary instruments
immediately.
We would appreciate very much permission from the owers
and lessees of the Varney field to locate the meteorological
station on this fleld, as per the may enclosed, with
of access to the same.
Of
the privilege
course, it would be understood that in
the event that the overs sold the property before June 30, 1928,
from the overs that we would remove the structure.
Iron the ordeal that u would sonov *hat upon tured to al notice
the priviloge of removing the structure and instruments at
the expiration of the observation period.
sign.
I an enclosing a letter for the owners and lessees to
Thanking you in advance for any courtesies you may extend
to us, I am
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JJP:KH

properties.sfomuseum:airport: Mills Field Municipal Airport of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:description: Facsimile of correspondence from Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco, to Lloyd H. Berendsen, dated May 18, 1927, concerning request to install meteorological station at Varney Field in conjunction with lease of Mills Estate property in San Mateo County for use as airport; file copy, not signed or mailed.
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco
